messages.subject: What do you make of this?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/16/03 5:02:18 PM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/16/03 5:02:18 PM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I hear that a lot when I'm in the library. A parent will tell the child
that they already have enough books, or they must take 2 and only 2, or
something like that. >>

Really!!!
Long before I was even thinking about unschooling (heck, I hadn't thought
about homeschooling yet) when Trevor was three, we overheard a mother saying
"you have a bunch of books at home we haven't even read yet, you don't need
any of THESE" as she hauled her crying dd out of the library.
SHEESH!! I thought the whole point of going to the library was to get free
BOOKS.
But apparently she thought her dd should go to story time and just ignore the
rows and rows of wonderful books in front of her.
I remember being very angry and Trevor asking why the little girl couldn't
have books.
I told him her Mommy wasn't very nice or something unkind I'm sure. :(
We were both baffled.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
